means: 茂盛，繁荣( flourish的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Britain has the largest and most flourishing fox population in Europe.
sentence.Network_cn: 英国拥有欧洲最大也是最具繁殖能力的狐狸种群。

sentence.Network_en: London quickly became a flourishing port.
sentence.Network_cn: 伦敦迅速成为了一个繁荣的港口。

sentence.Network_en: Few businesses are flourishing in the present economic climate.
sentence.Network_cn: 在目前的经济气候下，很少有企业兴旺发达。

flourishing development of hydropower and rural electrification ., 水电及农村电气化蓬勃发展.

entry.def: If something flourishes, it is successful, active, or common, and developing quickly and strongly.

example.ex: Business flourished and within six months they were earning 18,000 roubles a day...
example.tran: 生意红火起来，不出6 个月他们就可以每天赚 18,000 卢布了。

example.ex: Racism and crime still flourish in the ghetto.
example.tran: 城市贫民区的种族主义和犯罪仍然十分猖獗。

entry.tran: (植物或动物)长势好，茁壮成长
entry.def: If a plant or animal flourishes, it grows well or is healthy because the conditions are right for it.

example.ex: The plant flourishes particularly well in slightly harsher climes.
example.tran: 这种植物在气候条件稍差一点的地区长势尤其好。

entry.def: If you flourish an object, you wave it about in a way that makes people notice it.

example.ex: He flourished the glass to emphasize the point.
example.tran: 他挥动手中的杯子来强调这一点。

entry.def: If you do something with a flourish, you do in a showy way so that people notice it.

example.ex: She tended to finish dancing with a flourish.
example.tran: 她往往以夸张的姿势结束舞蹈。

entry.def: A flourish is a curly line or piece of decoration.

example.ex: He scrawled his name across the bill, underlining it with a showy flourish.
example.tran: 他在账单上潦草地签上自己的名字，并在名字下面画了一条花体线。

means.word_mean: 1. having or showing vigorous vegetal or animal life;

auth_sentence.content: In contrast, the Thai banking market is flourishing.
auth_sentence.res_content: In contrast, the Thai banking market is flourishing.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In contrast, the Thai banking market is flourishing.

auth_sentence.content: They are part of any just, flourishing society.
auth_sentence.res_content: They are part of any just, flourishing society.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They are part of any just, flourishing society.

auth_sentence.content: Kapolon said agribusinesses are now flourishing in the village.
auth_sentence.res_content: Kapolon said agribusinesses are now flourishing in the village.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Kapolon said agribusinesses are now flourishing in the village.

Sentence.sentence: Small Schools Rising This year's list of the top 100 high schools shows that today, those with fewer students are flourishing.
What can the West's overly indebted and sluggish (经济滞长的) nations learn from a flourishing Asia?

means.word_mean: 繁荣的, 昌盛的; 欣欣向荣的, 蒸蒸日上的

sentences.en: Archaeologists attribute the ruin to a flourishing prehistoric kingdom.
sentences.cn: 考古学家认为这些废墟属于一个繁荣的史前王国。

sentences.en: Centuries ago,this deserted place was a flourishing town,but a tornado is said to have wiped it out.
sentences.cn: 几个世纪前,这片荒芜的地方曾是一座繁荣的小镇,可据说一场龙卷风扫平了它。

sentences.en: His business seemed to be flourishing.
I used to see three films a week in the golden age when cinemas were flourishing.
sentences.cn: 在过去电影业处于兴旺时期,我一个星期看三部电影。

sentences.en: When he had established a flourishing business,he was bought out by a larger concern.
sentences.cn: 正当生意兴隆时,他的全部股权被一家较大的商行买下了。

sentences.en: He was almost single-handedly responsible for the flourishing drug trade in the town.
sentences.cn: 镇上猖獗的毒品交易几乎都是他一手造成的。
